channel.title: Scaline?
channel.description: anybody know where the scale line filter is? or what ever it is?

item.title: Scaline?
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“fellixombc, post:3, topic:138802”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=190747.msg1717965#msg1717965 date=1188544693]
Search Button, there are loads of tutorials on these forums… for scanlines…

I loled @ the filter…
[/quote]
no i am asking how do i do scaline lol, i see many tuts on Planet renders, e.g, this one to be exact: http://xiaofox.deviantart.com/art/Signature-tut-Music-62993012[/quote]

Yes I know… There are tuts on how to MAKE and USE a scanline…

Read full topic

item.title: Scaline?
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

goatee:

It’s a pattern so just make a 3x3 canvas (for 4 x 4 + if you want the line more spaced out) then get your pencil tool and make three pixels go from the top left hand corner down to the bottom right. Then delete any background you had and go to edit > define pattern and then in a sig just get your fill tool and go to pattern then just use that one and you get scanlines.

then i have it, omg lol xD

Read full topic

item.title: Scaline?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

It’s a pattern so just make a 3x3 canvas (for 4 x 4 + if you want the line more spaced out) then get your pencil tool and make three pixels go from the top left hand corner down to the bottom right. Then delete any background you had and go to edit > define pattern and then in a sig just get your fill tool and go to pattern then just use that one and you get scanlines.

item.title: Scaline?
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Let me spell it out…
S-c-a-n-l-i-n-e.

It is not a filter, it is not a brush (well, i guess you could make one).
It is a preset that you can create, and in many different forms/directions/colors. Google it, or better yet, try searching through the tutorial section (because I know you’ll find one).

Read full topic
